subject: Fashion
title: Plant-Based Dyes Revival
description: A 60-second lesson on Plant-Based Dyes Revival.

hook.text: Before synthetic dyes arrived in 1856, every color in your clothing came from plants, bugs, or minerals.

buildup.text: Indigo from leaves, red from cochineal beetles, yellow from turmericâ€”nature supplied the full spectrum.

discovery.text: Designers are reviving plant dyes using waste like avocado pits and onion skinsâ€”colors from compost.

twist.text: Plant dyes are non-toxic but less colorfast. They fade faster, which fast fashion culture won't tolerate.

climax.text: The irony: a fading dye is more sustainable. Accepting imperfection is part of the solution.

punchline.text: Nature's palette is backâ€”and it fades beautifully.

quiz.question: What is a drawback of plant-based dyes compared to synthetic ones?
options: They are significantly more toxic to produce and handle
They are less colorfast and fade more quickly over time
They can only produce a very limited range of colors
